    • Method Detail

      • fnInit

        public static void fnInit(android.app.Activity mainActivity)

      • fnAlertDialog

        public static void fnAlertDialog(android.content.Context ctx,
                                 int id,
                                 java.lang.String title,
                                 java.lang.String message,
                                 java.lang.String posButtonText,
                                 java.lang.String negButtonText)
        Shows an uncancelable alert dialog. When the user clicks a a button, fnAlertDialogResult is called with the id of the dialog and the clicked button.
        Parameters:
        ctx - The context. If null is passed, G.currentActivity will be used (if it is not null itself)
        id - The unique id of the dialog
        title - The title of the dialog or null if no title desired
        message - The message to be shown
        posButtonText - The text for the positive button or null if no button desired
        negButtonText - The text for the negative button or null if no button desired

      • fnAlertDialog

        public static void fnAlertDialog(android.content.Context ctx,
                                 int id,
                                 int title,
                                 int message,
                                 int posButtonText,
                                 int negButtonText)
        Shows an uncancelable alert dialog. When the user clicks a a button, fnAlertDialogResult is called with the id of the dialog and the clicked button.
        Parameters:
        ctx - The context
        id - The unique id of the dialog
        title - The title of the dialog or 0 if no title desired
        message - The message to be shown
        posButtonText - The text for the positive button or 0 if no button desired
        negButtonText - The text for the negative button or 0 if no button desired
